page.title: 01OVERVIEW,NORTH EAST TELFORD.
page.content: The Wellington-Stafford road running WSW-ENE is the backbone of our area. On either side are older houses and a few shops with newer housing estates on the south side where the ground rises gently. Here there is evidence of old coal and iron works and of the canals and railways that served them. To the north flat farming land can be seen, but a huge area is taken up by the army's Central Ordnance Depot. In the past, immigrants from other parts of Britain have settled in this area,many working in the army Depot or the growing New Town.People began arriving from Europe and Asia during the 1950s. They have kept many of their own customs and religions. This is a busy urban area in spite of 20% unemployment.People work and play mainly within Telford but many own a car to take them further afield.
